intro: Adonis ramosa subsp. fupingensis, commonly known as the Fuping Adonis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
